items.title: Neuroprotective Effects of PEP-1-PGAM5 via the Attenuation of Oxidative Stress and Apoptosis in Parkinson's Disease
items.description: Parkinson's disease (PD) is driven by mitochondrial impairment and oxidative stress-induced dopaminergic cell death. Phosphoglycerate mutase 5 (PGAM5) augmented accelerating mitophagy and attenuating neuronal apoptosis. Here, we present a novel cell-penetrating PEP-1-PGAM5 fusion protein designed to suppress oxidative damage and apoptosis. items.description: The present study investigated how acoustic and phonetic characteristics of synthetic and natural voices affect personality impressions of the voices. items.title: Hepatitis B Vaccination Histories in Persons with HIV Needing Revaccination
items.description: CONCLUSIONS: Regardless of past vaccine records, antibody titers should be checked in PWH for revaccination needs. The recently approved long-acting (LA) and injectable antiretroviral treatment (ART) lacks protective effect against HBV, unlike tenofovir-based ART. As the LA ART becomes more widely used, we recommend reassessing serologies and offering the recommended CpG-adjuvanted vaccine series with promising response durability to individuals without seroprotection.
items.conclusion: Regardless of past vaccine records, antibody titers should be checked in PWH for revaccination needs. The recently approved long-acting (LA) and injectable antiretroviral treatment (ART) lacks protective effect against HBV, unlike tenofovir-based ART

items.title: In Vivo Skin 3-D Surface Reconstruction and Wrinkle Depth Estimation Using Handheld High Resolution Tactile Sensing
items.description: 3-D skin surface reconstruction offers promise for objective and quantitative dermatological assessment, but no portable, high-resolution device exists that has been validated and used for depth reconstruction across various body locations. We present a compact 3-D skin reconstruction probe based on GelSight tactile imaging with a custom elastic gel and a learning-based reconstruction algorithm for micron-level wrinkle height estimation. items.title: Electron Microscopy Approaches to Unraveling the Structure of Amorphous Materials
items.description: Determining atomic structures in crystalline materials-where atoms are arranged in rigid, periodic lattices-has been highly successful using probes such as electrons, X-rays, and neutrons. In contrast, amorphous materials, despite their ubiquity and technological importance, remain far more challenging to characterize with comparable accuracy and precision. items.title: Electrically Tunable and Linearly Polarized Mid-Infrared Photoluminescence in 2D Tellurium
items.description: The integration of electronic and photonic chips hinges on the availability of efficient light sources and modulators that are compatible with on-chip interconnects. Among these, mid-infrared (mid-IR) emitters are especially critical, as they enable low-loss transmission through atmospheric windows and unlock powerful capabilities for molecular fingerprinting and chemical sensing. items.title: Implementation and Effectiveness Outcomes of a Pilot Comparative Effectiveness Randomized Controlled Trial Evaluating a Food Is Medicine Program Among At-Risk Pediatric Populations
items.description: Introduction: Food Is Medicine (FIM) programs have demonstrated effectiveness in improving diet quality and food insecurity. There remains a lack of evidence of their impacts in pediatric populations. items.title: Homology-Guided Zwitterionic Interlayers for 21% Efficiency Non-Fullerene Organic Solar Cells
items.description: The performance evolution of organic solar cells (OSCs) is increasingly constrained by a growing mismatch between state-of-the-art photoactive layers and conventional cathode interlayer materials (CIMs). Here, we report a homology-guided molecular design strategy to synchronize CIM with fused-ring electron acceptors (FREAs). items.title: High Performance 4.6 V LiCoO<sub>2</sub> Cathode Materials Enabled by Surface Lattice Modulation
items.description: Charging the cathode of LiCoO(2) (LCO) to higher voltages, typically 4.6 V, is able to increase reversible capacity, but meanwhile raises serious stability issues. Here, through a decomposition-induced reconstruction (DIR) process, we demonstrate the possibility of modulating the surface lattice of LCO with high precision in depth control, thereby enabling the 4.6 V LCO cathode to have both high capacity and structural integrity. items.description: Dendrite-free lithium anodes are crucial for developing practical high-energy-density batteries (>400 Wh/kg) with extended cycle life, but conventional interface design lack self-adaptive adjustment against dendrite growth during Li plating. items.description: Saccharomyces cerevisiae is widely used in food and beverage production but faces stresses such as acidity during processing. items.title: Unbiased metagenomic exploration of transfusion-transmitted infections with nanopore sequencing
items.description: BACKGROUND: Despite advances in blood safety, emerging infectious agents continue to pose risks to the blood supply. Traditional nucleic acid testing assays primarily target known pathogens, limiting the detection of novel microbes. Nanopore metagenomic sequencing enables agnostic identification of diverse pathogens, potentially enhancing transfusion safety surveillance.
